testDescription: Targeted practice for identified content gaps: Integer Systems, Factorial Divisibility, and Inequality Logic.
skillsAssessed: Integer solutions to systems of linear equations
Factorial divisibility with hidden prime factors
Inequality constraint logic with necessity reasoning
Advanced number theory and prime factorization

questions.questionText: A jar contains only nickels (5¢) and dimes (10¢). If there are exactly 50 cents worth of coins and exactly 8 coins total, how many nickels are in the jar?
A store sells notebooks for $3 each and pens for $2 each. If Maria buys exactly 12 items and spends exactly $31, how many notebooks did she buy?
A piggy bank contains quarters (25¢), dimes (10¢), and nickels (5¢). There are 20 coins total worth exactly $3.00. If there are twice as many dimes as nickels, how many quarters are there?

A factory produces widgets in three sizes: small ($5), medium ($8), and large ($12). Yesterday they produced 6 widgets and generated $46 in revenue. If they produced 1 more small widget than large widgets, how many medium widgets did they produce?

A vending machine accepts only quarters (25¢), dimes (10¢), and nickels (5¢). For a purchase totaling 95 cents using exactly 11 coins, which of the following represents a possible number of quarters used?

I. 0
II. 1
III. 2

A coin collection contains half dollars (50¢), quarters (25¢), dimes (10¢), and pennies (1¢). The total value is 172 cents using exactly 8 coins. If there are equal numbers of half dollars and quarters, and equal numbers of dimes and pennies, how many pennies are in the collection?
A bakery sells items at $15, $12, $8, and $5. They sold 12 items for $124 total. Items sold at $15 equal items sold at $5. Items at $12 outnumber items at $8 by 2. How many $8 items were sold?
What is the greatest positive integer n such that 2^n divides 8!?
What is the greatest positive integer n such that 5^n divides 10!?
What is the greatest positive integer n such that 3^n divides (7! + 6!)?
What is the greatest positive integer n such that 2^n divides (9! - 8!)?
What is the greatest positive integer n such that 7^n divides (14!/2!)?
What is the greatest positive integer n such that 6^n divides (12! - 11!×5)?
What is the greatest positive integer n such that 10^n divides (15! - 3×14! + 2×13!)?

If x > 5, which of the following must be true?

I. x > 3
II. x² > 25
III. |x| > 5

If 2x + 3 > 11, which of the following must be true?

I. x > 4
II. x² > 16
III. x + 1 > 5

If -3 < x < 1, which of the following must be true?

I. x² < 9
II. |x| < 3
III. x + 5 > 0

If |x - 2| < 3, which of the following must be true?

I. x > -1
II. x < 5
III. |x| < 6

If 3 < (x + 1)/2, which of the following must be true?

I. x > 5
II. |x - 3| > 2
III. -(x - 7) < 0

If x² - 4x + 3 < 0, which of the following must be true?

I. x > 0
II. x < 4
III. |x - 2| < 1

If 2 < (5 - x)/3, which of the following must be true?

I. x < -1
II. |x + 2| > 1
III. -(x + 3) > 0
IV. x² - 4 < 0
